node.statement: Lance Armstrong is still recognized as a Tour de France winner.
node.desc: All of his Tour de France titles have been revoked on account of the doping scandal surrounding the cyclist.

node.statement: No professional cyclist has ever been caught doping.
node.desc: A number of professional cyclists have now been proved to have used doping drugs.

node.statement: Over 150 cyclists take part in the Tour de France.
The first Tour de France was held at the beginning of the 20th century.
Lance Armstrong won the Tour de France in 2012.
node.desc: Bradley Wiggins won the Tour de France in 2012.

node.statement: The Tour de France awards a green jersey to one cyclist.
The polka-dot Tour de France jersey has green dots.
node.desc: The polka-dot Tour de France jersey has red dots.

node.statement: The Tour de France lasts three years.
node.desc: The Tour de France lasts three weeks.

node.statement: The tire pressure on a racing bike goes up to approx. 2300 bar.
node.desc: The tire pressure on a racing bike typically goes up to 14 bar.

node.statement: The Tour de France takes place in January.
node.desc: The Tour de France takes place in June/July.

node.statement: During organized races, cyclists must wear a helmet.
Mike Tyson once bit off a piece of Muhammad Ali's ear.
node.desc: Mike Tyson once bit off a piece of Evander Holyfield's ear.

node.statement: A boxing ring is circular.
A boxing match can only be decided with a K.O.
node.desc: There are several other ways a boxing match can be decided.

node.statement: A "jab" is a type of punch.
Muhammad Ali is a former American boxer.
The Klitschko brothers are famous comedians.

node.statement: The heavyweight class is the supreme discipline in boxing.
Boxers do not usually wear gloves during matches.
node.desc: Boxing gloves are an integral part of a boxer's kit.

node.statement: The boxer Mike Tyson was the youngest world heavyweight champion.
Muhammad Ali never became World Champion.

node.statement: Muhammad Ali used to be a professional tennis player.

node.statement: Mike Tyson has never lost a boxing match.
node.desc: Mike Tyson lost six of 58 fights.

node.statement: The boxing match between Klitschko and Muhammad Ali went down in boxing history.
node.desc: These two boxers never fought one another.

node.statement: Muhammad Ali's birth name was Cassius Clay.
"The Rumble in the Jungle" was a historic boxing match.
Rocky Balboa once won a boxing match against Muhammad Ali.

node.statement: Poker is a ball sport.
"Texas Hold 'em" is a variant of poker.
The best standard hand in poker is a "Full House".
node.desc: The highest hand is a "Royal Flush".

node.statement: The "Big Blind" is a term used in poker.
There is no world championship in poker.
node.desc: The "World Series of Poker" began in 1970.

node.statement: "Bluffing" is a tactic used in poker.
Online poker has been banned since 2000 in the USA.
node.desc: There is no ban on online poker in the USA.

node.statement: The "poker face" is an important element of poker.
There are 1240 cards in a standard deck of cards.
node.desc: There are 52 cards in a deck.

node.statement: There are more than two million possible card combinations in poker.
Each game of poker has to have at least eight players.
node.desc: Poker can be played with as few as two people.

node.statement: There are more than 40 million poker players across the world.
node.desc: The ace is the highest card in poker, but there isn't a blue one.

node.statement: A "straight" is a hand in poker.
Poker players aren't allowed to wear sunglasses.
node.desc: Sunglasses and hats are permitted during poker games.

node.statement: "Heads up" describes a one-on-one game of poker.
There are 55 pins in a bowling game.
node.desc: There are only 10 pins in a bowling game.

node.statement: In bowling, a "strike" is when a player knocks down all pins at once.
A standard bowling ball has six finger holes.
node.desc: A standard bowling ball has only three finger holes.

node.statement: In bowling tournaments, the balls have to be black.
node.desc: Players can choose whichever color ball they like.

node.statement: Bowling shoes have smooth soles.
Up until the end of the 18th century, bowling balls were made of wood.
A wakeboard is a piece of watersports equipment shaped like a plank.
Surfing originated in the Czech Republic.
Wakeboarding requires a pair of skis.

node.statement: The ball used in water polo is filled with water.

node.statement: Jet skiing requires a pair of skis.

node.statement: Rowing competitions are known as regattas.
Synchronized divers have to be twins.

node.statement: Dragon boats have an engine.
The "butterfly" is the name of a swimming stroke.
Professional swimmers are not allowed to wear goggles in the water.

node.statement: "Underwater ice hockey" is a real pastime.
In rowing, nine people sit in an "eight" (a rowing boat).

"Cliff diving" is a type of scuba diving.

node.statement: Kung Fu is part of track and field.

node.statement: Taekwondo is a Korean martial art.
